title: An 85-year Harvard study found the No. 1 thing that makes us happy in life: It helps us 'live longer'
description: In 1938, Harvard researchers embarked on a decades-long study to find out: What is the secret to a happy life? Contrary to what think, it's not career achievement, money, exercise, or a healthy diet.

title: Google employees criticize CEO Sundar Pichai for ‘rushed, botched’ announcement of GPT competitor Bard
description: In addition to a slide in its stock, Alphabet is facing criticism from employees following the announcement of its ChatGPT competitor this week.

title: U.S. shoots down second 'high altitude object' on Biden's orders
description: The mission took place off the coast of Alaska, less than a week after a high altitude Chinese spy balloon was shot down off the coast of South Carolina.

title: Amazon is the latest threat to Facebook as ad targeting suffers
description: Brands are shifting ad budgets away from Facebook and toward Amazon now that targeting users across social networks has become more difficult.

title: 34-year-old's startup, worth $1.5 billion and backed by Google, wants to make tutoring free for kids everywhere
description: Phil Cutler waned to help make private tutoring more affordable. Now, his startup Paper is worth $1.5 billion and backed by investors like Google and Softbank.

title: Zelenskyy completes a tricky charm offensive in Europe as Ukraine prepares for next phase of war
description: The European Union, the largest donor of financial aid to Ukraine, had wanted a visit from the Ukrainian leader for several months.

title: Oil prices rise 2% after Russia says it will cut output by 500,000 barrels a day
description: Russia will reduce its oil output by 500,000 barrels per day in March, Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said on Friday.

title: Vietnamese EV maker VinFast says job cuts won't derail plans to start U.S. production
description: Vietnam's EV maker VinFast said that its U.S. plant is still on track to start production in 2024 despite a reduction of its U.S. headcount.

title: China's biggest chipmaker SMIC posts record 2022 revenue but warns of a tough year ahead
description: China's biggest chipmaker SMIC posted record revenue in 2022, despite ongoing U.S. sanctions, but warned of a more difficult year ahead.

title: Japanese yen jumps on report Kazuo Ueda will be next governor of the central bank
description: The Japanese yen pushed higher against both the euro and U.S. dollar after a Nikkei report said Kazuo Ueda would be the next Bank of Japan governor.

title: Adidas shares tank after it issues warning over unsold Yeezy stock
description: Adidas shares plummeted after the company said it could lose around 1.2 billion euros ($1.3 billion) in revenue in 2023 if it is unable to sell Yeezy stock.

title: Chinese IPOs are coming back to the U.S.
description: Chinese startups are raising millions of dollars in U.S. stock market listings again, after a dry spell in the once-hot market.

title: UK narrowly avoids recession in back half of 2022 despite December slump
description: The British economy showed no growth in the final quarter of 2022, but shrunk by 0.5% in December — more than expected by analysts.

title: Russia is expected to launch a new Ukraine offensive, but it faces a familiar obstacle: Mud
description: Ukraine's frozen ground is expected to thaw soon, turning the war-torn nation's fields and rural roads into a quagmire for troops and tanks.

title: As Brits reel from a cost-of-living crisis, the UK stock market quietly booms to an all-time high
description: The FTSE 100 has hit three all-time highs over the last week, despite continued gloom on the U.K. economy and amid a cost-of-living crisis.

title: CNBC Daily Open: U.S. stocks drop and Treasury yields widen their inversion as the economy gives conflicting signals
description: U.S. stocks drop as Treasury yields widen their inversion. The U.S. economy gives conflicting signals.

title: The return of El Nino could make the world even hotter — endangering a critical climate threshold
description: El Nino is widely recognized as the warming of the sea surface temperature, which occurs every few years.

title: K-pop stocks soar after agency behind BTS announced it would become its rival’s top shareholder
description: The K-pop agency behind BTS is set to become the largest shareholder of SM Entertainment.

title: What do Chinese travelers want? Luxury 'star-rated' hotels, says new survey
description: Consumers in China plan to pay up when it comes to hotels, a Morgan Stanley survey found in late January.
